docs.snippet: On Avenue B, a couple from California found tasty Mexican food and a good place to watch the World Cup.

docs.snippet: Luis Suárez curled in a spectacular shot in the 80th minute to help Uruguay advance to the quarterfinals for the first time since 1970.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suárez curled in a spectacular shot in the 80th minute to help Uruguay advance to the quarterfinals for the first time since 1970.

headline.seo: In Sliver of Open Space, Uruguay Finds a Route Past South Korea

docs.snippet: Saturday night, there was no rescuing sprint as the United States lost to Ghana, 2-1, in the second round.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saturday night, there was no rescuing sprint as the United States lost to Ghana, 2-1, in the second round.

headline.seo: A Final Day of Chasing Ends the U.S. Run
headline.main: A Final Day of Chasing Ends the U.S. Run

docs.snippet: For Ghana to field 19- and 20-year-olds and match the best qualities of the United States — in athleticism, stamina and never-say-die spirit — is what this tournament desperately needed.
docs.lead_paragraph: For Ghana to field 19- and 20-year-olds and match the best qualities of the United States — in athleticism, stamina and never-say-die spirit — is what this tournament desperately needed.

headline.seo: Ghana’s Skill and Spirit Top the United States’ Experience
headline.main: Keeping the Africa in Africa’s World Cup
headline.print_headline: Ghana’s Win Over U.S. Buoys Africa’s Hopes

docs.snippet: European bloodletting begins in earnest in Bloemfontein this morning as Germany meets England in the round of 16.
docs.lead_paragraph: Germany crushed England, 4-1, in the round of 16 in Bloemfontein this afternoon, adding Fabio Capello's team to a World Cup roll of dishonor that includes Italy and France.
docs.abstract: European bloodletting begins in earnest in Bloemfontein this morning as Germany meets England in the round of 16.

headline.main: World Cup Live: Germany vs. England

docs.snippet: Welcome to another stage of the second round - or as they say in Mexico, "Welcome to our Nightmare." Continue reading for live analysis of the Argentina-Mexico match.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina stepped out of group play and into the knockout round, where if the pressure was supposed to be ramped up, it was never apparent.
docs.abstract: Welcome to another stage of the second round - or as they say in Mexico, "Welcome to our Nightmare." Continue reading for live analysis of the Argentina-Mexico match.

docs.snippet: Salvador Cabañas would have been leading Paraguay’s attack when it faces Japan on Tuesday but for the bullet lodged in his brain.
docs.lead_paragraph: Salvador Cabañas would have been leading Paraguay’s attack when it faces Japan on Tuesday but for the bullet lodged in his brain.

headline.seo: After Shooting, Paraguay Star Is Left Behind
headline.main: Soccer Star Left Behind After Shooting
headline.print_headline: After a Shooting, a Star Is Left Behind

docs.snippet: Now that the United States national team is out of the World Cup, how do all those newly minted Americans soccer fans deal with the rest of the tournament?
docs.lead_paragraph: I get it. Only a few days ago you were at your oil derivatives hedge fund office hugging your boss in a moment of Landon Donovan-induced lunacy. You, the Park Slope mom, once only burdened by carrot-washing duties at the Co-Op and pushing a MacLaren stroller, suddenly felt the weight of a Clint Dempsey crush. And all of you in New York and elsewhere, like surfers riding the Great American Soccer Wave till it came crashing down on a Black Star coral reef, left wondering: What do you do now?
docs.abstract: Now that the United States national team is out of the World Cup, how do all those newly minted Americans soccer fans deal with the rest of the tournament?

headline.main: How to Cope With the U.S. Gone

docs.snippet: Sepp Blatter said on Tuesday that he would reopen the discussion about the use of goal-line technology in soccer.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sepp Blatter said on Tuesday that he would reopen the discussion about the use of goal-line technology in soccer.

headline.seo: FIFA’s Blatter Apologizes for Refereeing Errors at World Cup
headline.print_headline: GOAL; In Shift, Blatter Apologizes For Errors
